summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel and a contractor regarding the scanning and organization of records related to Jeffrey Epstein. The contractor reports on organizing files, including commissary receipts and prison documents from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), where Epstein was held.

persons.name: Will
persons.context: Addressed in an email regarding updating logs and acknowledged for completing the scanning and organization of Epstein-related prison records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the prison records being scanned and organized, specifically mentioned in relation to commissary receipts and financial documents from his time at MCC.

connections.description: Will, as a contractor for the US Attorney's Office, was tasked with scanning and organizing prison records pertaining to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scanning and Organization of Epstein Prison Records
events.description: A contractor for the US Attorney's Office completes scanning and organizing a batch of records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center related to Jeffrey Epstein, including commissary receipts and training documents.

events.title: MCC Training Date Referenced
events.description: A file labeled 'MCC training 06-06-19' is mentioned among the organized prison records, indicating a training date potentially relevant to prison procedures.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
keyFacts: In August 2019, the U.S. Attorney's Office was actively processing prison records related to Jeffrey Epstein from the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The records included commissary receipts and financial documents detailing Epstein's activity inside the prison.
The documents included MCC training materials and daily key count logs, suggesting a focus on prison operations and security.
The email chain indicates an organized effort to log subpoena requests and track outstanding document requests in the investigation.
